result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth A Twyman

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Richards notified the clerk hearing would need to be rescheduled. Clerk to contact the parties via email and reschedule Status Conference.
Status Conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 3:00 pm. Hearing will be held in room 310 of the Safety Building.

OFF THE RECORD: 
Defendant Kenneth A Twyman not in court, in custody in Waukesha.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Kenneth A Twyman.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia Irene Daugherty, on behalf of Amy Spanczak, in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. State informs the court that defendant has pending matter in another county. parties request additional time to for reasons regarding said case. For reasons stated on the record, court grants request.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-13, this case has been reassigned to Judge Franke.

22RM037505  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFF
08/02/2022
Level 5 supervision from Justice Point. All previously ordered conditions remains.

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video means. State is requesting bond be forfeited. Court increases cash bail to $15,000 but does not forfeit previously posted bail. Court orders Level 5 supervision from Justice Point. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bench warrant cleared by Sheriff's Department on 7/9/2022. Case is scheduled for 7/13/2022 for return on warrant/bail hearing in branch 16. Notice is sent to state and defense.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Mark D. Richards in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further takes no action as to bail.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

violation report (new charge 22cf1550)
(forwarded for review)

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court with Attorney Brian Dimmer for Mark D. Richards.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  The status counsel was held via zoom.  The defendant has hired private counsel and is awaiting discovery and the state's offer. Defense is requesting an additional status conference. The state requests an in-person date for reasons stated on the records.  The court grants defense request and the matter is adjourned back to Branch 16 in person.

Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 9:00am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report  received and filed

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Arraignment. All parties appeared via zoom. Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-1-22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 2-28-22

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milw County Sheriff Detective R. Richards.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 2-14-22
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 2-4-22

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense Counsel is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
22RM001595  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 01/08/2022

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth A Twyman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
ENTRY MADE IN ERROR.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
